node.title: Story of my day.
node.excerpt: I'm just putting this together before bed. Feeling rather reflective, I'm documenting my day. It's an archetype of my existence, being a caregiver and being this goofy human being in small town nowhere.

node.title: Camping?
node.excerpt: Over the New Year's vacation I got invited by a friend to visit him and his family while they were camping at a nearby site. It was the real deal! Extra large tents, barbeques, mosquitoes - the works. There might have been a plug to charge a phone, but that'd be about it. Hipsters could call it a digital detox. The idea of a whole week without screens, games and lines of code made him shiver.

node.title: Brains!
node.excerpt: This won't make sense, but I'm trying here.

node.title: Up, up, up! Down, down, down...
node.excerpt:
2018 hasn't been a very... progressive year.

After moving back from the city at the end of last year, my responsibilities and life have become rather static. I get told I do an important job and do it well, but I still feel sharply pathetic revealing what I do. Saying to someone that I look after an elderly man in a small, dead town isn't very attractive. <

node.title: A Little Help from my Friends
node.excerpt:
After a whole year, I'm back on this here train.

youtube:https://www.youtube.com/embed/0C58ttB2-Qg

Thanks to extensive help from a good friend I was able to import my seven years of posts into this new system. And it was a task! IGN really didn't care about helping people keep their content from the ”little My IGN blogging experiment."

Side note: Really? You run a platform for 10 years, encourage people to use it under hopes of getting featured on the front page and even getting commissioned work from it and after all that you call it just a “little experiment”? That feels like a way to skirt all archival responsibility and belittle the extensive work that a sizeable number of your readers contributed. Thanks Peer. <

node.title: Veon 4K TV review
node.excerpt:
Ultra low cost bargain?

I live in New Zealand, a rather small country with a population of just under 5 million people. This relatively small amount of consumers can lead to a lack of product variety in some areas. Out side of the known brands – Samsung to Sony, Panasonic to Philips – there isn't much of a choice when it comes to low cost consumer electronics. There is just one exception I'm aware of to this, a store brand owned by the biggest department store chain in the country: Veon Televisions by The Warehouse. <

node.title: Human life is better now than it ever has been
node.excerpt: A common claim made by some religious doctrines is that the world is in an awful state, and that humanity is deteriorating. In many Christian denominations this is based on so called prophecies that are claimed to have been made thousands of years ago. It is generally stated that mankind, growing distant from their deity, would just hit the fan.

node.title: We Evolved
node.excerpt: As I wrote here a long time ago, I used to be associated with a rather well known and widespread religion – The Jehovah's Witnesses.

node.title: Life is Strange
node.excerpt: Part of the motivation behind leaving my life in the city was the lack of employment, but the main factor was that of family.

node.title: Insane
node.excerpt: Did I ever tell you what the definition of insanity is? Insanity is doing the exact... same thing... over and over again and… expecting a different outcome.
